author: gcontreras
title: Me llevo el cariÃ±o de todos los cucuteÃ±os: Lucas RÃ­os, tras su salida del CÃºcuta Deportivo
text: CÃºcuta Deportivo El volante argentino Lucas RÃ­os se convierte en la baja mÃ¡s sensible del CÃºcuta Deportivo para la temporada 2024. El jugador mÃ¡s destacado de la temporada 2023 en el CÃºcuta Deportivo se marcha de la instituciÃ³n rojinegra. El volante argentino Lucas RÃ­os, de 25 aÃ±os, anunciÃ³ su salida del cuadro fronterizo en el que actuÃ³ durante los Ãºltimos tres semestres. â€œMe llevo el cariÃ±o de todos los cucuteÃ±os para siempre. No tengo dudas que nos vamos a volver a encontrar. Esto no es una despedida, sino un hasta luego. Muchas gracias a todosâ€, escribiÃ³ el gaucho en sus redes sociales. Lea aquÃ­: Joider Micolta jugarÃ¡ en 2024 con AtlÃ©tico Bucaramanga RÃ­os, segÃºn informÃ³ el periodista argentino Mariano Olsen, aterrizarÃ­a en el fÃºtbol moldavo con el Sheriff Tiraspol, equipo que en las Ãºltimas temporadas ha participado en Champions League y Europa League. El motilÃ³n habrÃ­a ejecutado la opciÃ³n de compra por los derechos deportivos del 10, adjudicÃ¡ndose un porcentaje cercano al 70%. RÃ­os fue la pieza mÃ¡s destacada del segundo semestre con un rendimiento sobresaliente. Fue el mÃ¡ximo goleador del equipo en el Torneo II con siete anotaciones y asimismo liderÃ³ la tabla de asistencias con cinco. El talentoso diestro llegÃ³ en compaÃ±Ã­a del cancerbero Ezequiel MastrolÃ­a y el central Maxmiliano Coronel a mediados de 2022 tras el regreso del equipo al FÃºtbol Profesional Colombiano. Al comienzo, dejÃ³ serias dudas de su rendimiento actuando en solo ocho partidos. En 2023, el mediocampista que llegÃ³ tras actuar en Real Pilar de la cuarta divisiÃ³n de Argentina, consolidÃ³ su juego y se convirtiÃ³ en el eje creador de ataque en el fronterizo. Fue inamovible para Bernardo RedÃ­n, RubÃ©n Tanucci y Federico Barrionuevo. Sumando los juegos del Torneo I y II 2023, actuÃ³ en 37 oportunidades. Por Copa Colombia tuvo diez salidas y fue figura en las series ante Junior FC e Independiente MedellÃ­n, esta Ãºltima llave en la que hizo ver mal al volante Daniel Torres. En total, Lucas â€“quien fue uno de los capitanes- celebrÃ³ en 10 ocasiones dejando para el recuerdo su gol en el empate 2-2 ante Patriotas BoyacÃ¡ en los cuadrangulares finales del Torneo I. RÃ­os disparÃ³ desde la mitad del campo y firmÃ³ un golazo en la Independencia de Tunja. A propÃ³sito del golazo desde mitad de cancha del ðŸ‡¦ðŸ‡· Lucas RÃ­os ante Patriotas (2-2) en La Independencia de Tunja, recuerdo otros dos por la misma vÃ­a en los Ãºltimos aÃ±os: pic.twitter.com/yjqWUZNdIG â€” Gustavo Contreras Sabogal (@tcontrerasS) June 2, 2023 Esta salida se convierte en la mÃ¡s sensible para los rojinegros de cara a su temporada de ascenso 2024. RÃ­os se suma a los habituales titulares Ezequiel MastrolÃ­a (jugarÃ¡ con Once Caldas) y Joider Micolta (actuarÃ¡ con Bucaramanga) como bajas del plantel. Gustavo Contreras Sabogal Jueves, 28 CÃºcuta Deportivo 2023: aÃ±o de vagas ilusiones para el CÃºcuta Deportivo CÃºcuta Deportivo AsÃ­ serÃ¡ el camino del CÃºcuta Deportivo en el Torneo I-2024 CÃºcuta Deportivo CÃºcuta Deportivo proyecta regresar a la Liga femenina en 2024

author: RedacciÃ³n LAVOZ
title: â€œEstoy de reemplazoâ€: la insÃ³lita respuesta durante un corte de ruta contra el DNU de Milei
text: Las repercusiones y respuestas tras el anuncio del [mega-DNU que lanzÃ³ el presidente Javier Milei](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/politica/farmacias-marchan-presentan-un-amparo-y-cierran-una-hora-en-contra-del-mega-dnu-de-milei/), y que entrarÃ¡ en vigencia este viernes, continÃºan. Varias marchas y protestas se realizaron tras la cadena nacional del mandatario. Sin embargo, una de ellas llamÃ³ la atenciÃ³n este jueves por la insÃ³lita respuesta de una joven que participaba en un corte de ruta. Durante un mÃ³vil en vivo del canal C5N, la chica fue consultada por la notera y la respuesta que dio no tardÃ³ en viralizarse en las redes sociales. SuediÃ³ en la protesta contra el DNU encabezada por Luis Dâ€™ElÃ­a, que tenÃ­a lugar en la ruta 3, a la altura de Isidro Casanova, con un corte parcial de ruta. Cuando la joven fue consultada respecto a quÃ© no le gustaba del decreto anunciado por [Milei](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/politica/ley-omnibus-de-javier-milei-los-31-puntos-principales-y-el-hilo-imperdible-que-tuiteo-el-presidente/), la chica respondiÃ³ â€œestar de reemplazoâ€ en la manifestaciÃ³n. Durante la transmisiÃ³n en vivo, realizada esta maÃ±ana, la notera del canal consultÃ³ a los presentes respecto a por quÃ© protestaban en contra del decreto. Fue entonces cuando divisÃ³ a la chica: â€œA ver la gente jovencitaâ€, mencionÃ³ mientras se acercaba. [â€œContame, Â¿por quÃ© estÃ¡s acÃ¡?â€](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/politica/el-dnu-de-javier-milei-entra-en-vigencia-este-viernes-podria-la-justicia-suspenderlo/), le preguntÃ³. Con cara de no comprender la pregunta, la joven dijo: â€œporque estoy de reemplazoâ€, tras lo cual lanzÃ³ una risa nerviosa. ExtraÃ±ada, la notera le preguntÃ³ â€œÂ¿de reemplazo?â€. â€œNo me preguntÃ© mÃ¡s, por favorâ€, fue la respuesta de la chica. El video La insÃ³lita situaciÃ³n se dio en la protesta convocada por Juan Carlos Alderete, secretario general de la Corriente Clasista y Combativa (CCC), y por Luis Dâ€™ElÃ­a, quien estaba al frente de la demanda con un piquete sobre la ruta 3. La manifestaciÃ³n iniciÃ³ alrededor de las 10, en la mencionada ruta, entre las vÃ­as del ferrocarril y la calle GermÃ¡n Abdala. Se extendiÃ³ hasta las primeras horas de la tarde.

author: News Feed Editor
title: Your Android phone could have stalkerware - here's how to remove it
text:
Consumer-grade spyware apps that covertly and continually monitor your private messages, photos, phone calls, and real-time location are an ongoing problem for Android users.
This guide can help you identify and remove common surveillance apps from your Android phone, including TheTruthSpy, Cocospy and Spyic, among others.
Consumer-grade spyware apps are frequently sold under the guise of child monitoring or family-tracking software, but are referred to as â€œstalkerwareâ€ and â€œspousewareâ€ for their ability to also track and monitor partners or spouses without their consent. These spyware apps are downloaded from outside of Google Playâ€™s app store, planted on a phone without a personâ€™s permission and often disappear from the home screen to avoid detection.
Stalkerware apps rely on abusing in-built Android features that are typically used by companies to remotely manage their employeesâ€™ work phones or use Androidâ€™s accessibility mode to snoop on someoneâ€™s device.
You may notice your phone acting unusually, running warmer or slower than usual, or using large amounts of network data, even when you are not actively using it.
Checking to see if your Android device is compromised can be done quickly and easily.
Before you start
Itâ€™s important to have a safety plan in place and trusted support if you need it. Keep in mind that removing the spyware from your phone may alert the person who planted it, which could create an unsafe situation. The Coalition Against Stalkerware offers advice and guidance for victims and survivors of stalkerware.
Note that this guide only helps you to identify and remove spyware apps, it does not delete the data that was already collected and uploaded to its servers. Also, some versions of Android may have slightly different menu options. As is standard with any advice, you follow these steps at your own risk.
Make sure Google Play Protect is switched on
Make sure Google Play Protect, a security feature in Android phones, is enabled. Image Credits:TechCrunch / Getty Images
Google Play Protect is one of the best safeguards to protect against malicious Android apps by screening apps downloaded from Googleâ€™s app store and outside sources for signs of potentially malicious activity. Those protections stop working when Play Protect is switched off. Itâ€™s important to ensure that P â€¦

author: Maria Merano
title: Starlink ruffles some feathers in Italyâ€™s telco industry
text:
Starlinkâ€™s arrival seems to have ruffled some feathers in Italyâ€™s telco industry.
Last month, Italyâ€™s Undersecretary to the Prime Ministerâ€™s Office, Allessio Butti, shared that the country was preparing to test SpaceXâ€™s Starlink services in remote areas. Italyâ€™s telco association recently urged the government to review regulations for low-earth orbit satellite broadband operators before Starlinkâ€™s arrival.
A lobby group in Italy called Asstel submitted a document to the government outlining its concerns about Starlink.
Asstel states in the document that Italyâ€™s existing rules for low-orbit satellite broadband operators do not consider SpaceXâ€™s business model, which offers consumers devices to customers directly. The lobby group also pointed out that SpaceXâ€™s Starlink services compete directly with local telecom operators.
Asstel noted that the government should consider regulations over the use of frequencies and how it can enforce the rules to encourage companies to comply with them. The lobby group also brought up the storage of sensitive data, suggesting that the government should impose regulations for local storage.
According to Reuters, Asstelâ€™s document was an internal memo shared with a few politicians in Italy.
The Teslarati team would appreciate hearing from you. If you have any tips, contact me at or via Twitter @Writer_01001101.

author: Ganny Belloni
title: Eleventh Cir. Dismisses Florida Suit Over Child Health Premiums
text:
A lawsuit contesting the authority of federal guidance preventing children from being dropped from the Childrenâ€™s Health Insurance Program was dismissed after both parties in the case told a federal appeals court the complaint was now moot.
The US Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit on Thursday agreed to dismiss an appeal from the state of Florida that argued the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services unlawfully enforced a guidance letter and Q&A document notifying states that they could no longer disenroll children from CHIP if their parents fail to pay premiums.
The order comes after both the CMS ...

author: Evan Rosen
title: Lâ€™Oreal heiress becomes first woman with $100 billion net worth
text: The richest woman in the world, Lâ€™Oreal heiress Francoise Bettencourt Meyers, just became the [first woman to amass a $100 billion fortune](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-12-28/l-oreal-heir-francoise-bettencourt-meyers-is-first-woman-to-hit-100-billion), according to a report published Thursday by Bloomberg. The milestone marks a successful year for the Lâ€™Oreal company with its stock at a record-high, [bringing Bettencourt Meyersâ€™ net worth to $100.2 billion](https://www.cnn.com/2023/12/28/investing/francoise-bettencourt-meyers-100-billion-loreal/index.html), as measured by the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Bettencourt Meyers, 70, is the only child of Liliane Bettencourt, whose father, EugÃ¨ne Schueller, founded Lâ€™OrÃ©al. She inherited her motherâ€™s holdings when Bettencourt died in 2017. She now holds over 34% of the companyâ€™s stock and serves as the chairwoman of the familyâ€™s holding company, Tethys, as well as the vice chairwoman of Lâ€™Oreal Groupâ€™s board of directors. Already standing as the worldâ€™s largest cosmetics company, Lâ€™Orealâ€™s stock rose 35% this year, [its best year since 1998](https://www.afr.com/world/europe/l-oreal-heir-becomes-first-woman-with-us100b-fortune-20231229-p5eu3x), as spending on luxury goods has continued to increase since the pandemic. With a large portfolio of brands ranging from LancÃ´me to Maybelline, the Lâ€™Oreal Group did more than $42 billion (â‚¬38 billion) in sales in 2022, per company reports. Back in August, Lâ€™Oreal purchased Australian cosmetics brand Aesop for $2.5 billion â€” the largest brand acquisition ever completed by the company, according to financial markets platform Dealogic. Bettencourt Meyers now ranks as the 12th richest person in the world, directly behind Carlos Slim, a Mexican business magnate who became the first Latin American to cross the $100 billion threshold on Dec. 14. Tech billionaire and X owner Elon Musk [still sits atop the list, with a net worth estimated at around $240 billion](https://www.forbes.com/real-time-billionaires/#32cb38ba3d78), according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Heâ€™s followed by Bernard Arnault, the chair of luxury goods maker LVMH (the conglomerate behind Louis Vuitton), who comes in at around $180 billion.

author: Valentina Raffio
title: CataluÃ±a extiende los avisos naranjas y amarillos por lluvias torrenciales hasta el domingo
text: DANA CataluÃ±a extiende los avisos naranjas y amarillos por lluvias torrenciales hasta el domingo Siete comarcas catalanas estÃ¡n en alerta naranja este viernes y 14 mÃ¡s con avisos amarillos Valentina Raffio El Servei MeteorolÃ²gic de CataluÃ±a ha activado decenas de avisos amarillos y naranja ante el riesgo de que la [DANA](/tags/dana/) que esta semana ha azotado EspaÃ±a siga dejando lluvias torrenciales en el territorio durante los prÃ³ximos dÃ­as. Los pronÃ³sticos apuntan a que el temporal se seguirÃ¡ extendiendo hasta como mÃ­nimo el domingo, por lo que se han activado varios avisos ante la posibilidad de que las lluvias dejen mÃ¡s de 100 litros por metro cuadrado en algunos puntos del litoral catalÃ¡n. Por el momento, las zonas con mÃ¡s riesgo se concentran en el extremo sur, incluyendo el TarragonÃ¨s, el Baix Camp, el Priorat, Ribera d'Ebre, Terra Alta, Baix Ebre y MontsiÃ . En Barcelona, se ha activado un aviso amarillo para viernes, sÃ¡bado y domingo. Este viernes hay siete comarcas catalanas en alerta naranja por el paso de esta DANA. En el MontsiÃ , Baix Ebre y Terra Alta, hay activo un aviso naranja por acumulaciÃ³n de lluvias en tanto que podrÃ­an superarse los 100 litros por metro cuadrado a lo largo de la jornada. TambiÃ©n destaca otra alerta naranja por intensidad de las lluvias en toda la zona (desde el TarragonÃ¨s hasta el Baix Camp, el Priorat, Ribera d'Ebre), dado que entre este mediodÃ­a y la tarde podrÃ­an producirse descargas de hasta 40 litros en tan solo 30 minutos. En todas estas zonas, las autoridades piden a los residentes extremar las precauciones durante la jornada de este viernes. En Barcelona se ha activado un aviso amarillo para viernes, sÃ¡bado y domingo Este viernes tambiÃ©n hay 14 comarcas mÃ¡s en alerta amarilla: el BarcelonÃ¨s, Baix Llobregat, VallÃ¨s Occidental, Garraf, Alt PenedÃ¨s, Anoia, Alt Camp, Baix PenedÃ¨s, Conca de BarberÃ , Segarra, Urgell, Garrigues, Pla d'Urgell y SegriÃ . El aviso se extiende para toda la jornada del viernes y, en varios casos, tambiÃ©n de cara al sÃ¡bado. En estos puntos se esperan precipitaciones abundantes que en algunos casos podrÃ­an adquirir un carÃ¡cter torrencial. SegÃºn datos de la Agencia Estatal de MeteorologÃ­a, en el litoral y prelitoral de Barcelona se podrÃ­an registrar acumulaciones de hasta 20 litros por metro cuadrado en una hora. Cinco comunidades en alerta En el conjunto de EspaÃ±a, este viernes hay cinco comunidades autÃ³nomas en alerta por el paso de la DANA y al menos un aviso rojo activado en el litoral de Huelva, donde se podrÃ­an dar acumulaciones de mÃ¡s de 140 litros por metro cuadrado en tan solo unas horas. En localidades como Cartaya ya se han acumulado mÃ¡s de 117 litros por metro cuadrado en menos de tres horas, de los cuales 70 en un hora. TambiÃ©n se estÃ¡n registrando importantes trombas marinas asociadas a este evento. El domingo hay avisos amarillos activados para todo el litoral y prelitoral catalÃ¡n Los pronÃ³sticos sobre la evoluciÃ³n de esta DANA aÃºn son inciertos pero, segÃºn los modelos mÃ¡s actualizados, todo apunta a que el temporal seguirÃ¡ abriÃ©ndose paso durante el fin de semana. El domingo, de hecho, el Servei MeteorolÃ²gic de CataluÃ±a ha activado un aviso amarillo en todo el litoral y prelitoral catalÃ¡n, desde el Alt EmpordÃ  hasta les Terres de l'Ebre, por intensidad de lluvias. Para entonces hay casi una veintena de comarcas en aviso amarillo y tres mÃ¡s, situadas en el extremo sur, en aviso naranja. author: Nadeem Sarwar
title: New research finds that your smartwatch band is laced with toxic forever chemicals | Digital Trends
text:
Table of Contents Table of Contents This is a serious threat Expensive is not always good Just over a year ago, a study published in the Advances in Infectious Diseases journal detailed that 95% of the wearable straps for smartwatches and fitness bands were infected with different kinds of harmful bacteria .
Now, another research published in a reputed journal has revealed an even more sinister trend in straps sold for wrist-worn smart wearables. The paper, published in the ACSâ€™ Environmental Science & Technology Letters, highlights the presence of perfluorohexanoic acid (PFHxA) in fluoroelastomer bands offered by various top brands.
Recommended Videos The bands tested as part of the chemical analysis include those offered by big names like Google, Samsung, Apple, Fitbit, and CASETiFY. Interestingly, Samsung and Apple both sell watch bands made out of fluoroelastomers, the core problematic chemical at the center of the research, and even mention its â€œbenefitsâ€ on their websites.
Please enable Javascript to view this content The research paper raises concern about â€œthe very high concentration of PFHxA that can be readily extracted from the surfaces of watch bands made from fluoroelastomers.â€ The more worrisome part is that people wear these smart devices for more than daytime activities.
Related Smartwatches are in big trouble Subscriptions are quickly ruining fitness trackers How we test smartwatches and wearables NOTE : The American Chemical Society (ACS) provided Digital Trends with a copy of the research paper and the supporting information covering the test protocol and analysis methodology for their assessment.
As features like sleep-quality monitoring and sleep apnea detection enter the mainstream, people are supposed to wear them even while sleeping. â€œWearing these items for more than 12 hours per day poses an opportunity for significant transfer to the dermis and subsequent human exposure,â€ surmises the research team.
This is a serious threat Nadeem Sarwar / Digital Trends The research highlights how multiple straps were advertised to â€œsports and fitnessâ€ enthusiasts, which means they are worn during exercise. It could lead to increased sweat contact and open skin pores.
Apple, Samsung, and Google sell bands made out of fluoroelastomers.
Thatâ€™s concerning because related research suggests that a staggering 50% of PFHxA exposure is absorbed through the skin, and over a third enters the bloodstream. â€œOne study reported PFHxA was the third highest PFAS concentration measured in whole blood samples,â€ says the research team.
PFHxAs fall in a particularly dangerous class of chemicals known as forever chemicals, and have gained the infamous name because they persist and avoid the regular cycle of environmental breakdown. Whatâ€™s worrisome is that their detrimental impact is yet to be explored fully.
Nadeem Sarwar / Digital Trends A frequent presence in everything from cosmetics and cookware to clothing and electronics, they have been used for decades in consumer as well as industrial items, particularly owing to their resilience against heat, water, oil, and grease exposure. However, in recent years, their destructive impact has gained widespread recognition.
A significant percentage could pass through human skin under normal conditions.
Forever chemicals have been linked to a wide range of health issues, including cancer , and their presence has been documented in potable water supplies, soil, and even food items. As per the United States Environmental Protection Agency, PFHxA is one of the breakdown outcomes of per and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS).
Expensive is not always good Apple sells watch bands made out of fluoroelastomers. Nadeem Sarwar / Digital Trends As part of the research, the team focused on fluoroelastomers, which are essentially a class of synthetic rubbers made from PFAS, looking for the presence of fluorine and over a dozen other harmful chemicals. Interestingly, the more expensive bands exhibited a stronger presence of harmful chemicals than the cheaper ones.
Of the 22 bands and straps analyzed by the team, all the fluoroelastomer bands showed the presence of fluorine. Interestingly, bands that were not even explicitly made out of fluoroelastomer revealed the presence of fluorine, which is a strong sign of PFAS presence.
A subsequent chemical extraction process revealed the presence of PFHxA as the most common forever chemical in nine out of the 22 straps. On average, the PFHxA concentration came in at 800 parts per billion (ppb), which is four times higher than cosmetics. In one case, the concentration was as high as 16,000 parts per billion (ppb).
As per the research team, the high levels of PFHxA detected in the wristbands may be due to the use of this compound as a surfactant during the fluoroelastomer manufacturing process.
A high portion of these chemicals pass through the skin, and enter the bloodstream.
Alyssa Wicks, co-author of the research paper, recommends that customers should focus on lower-priced bands for their smartwatches and fitness bands if they seek to avoid PFHxA exposure.
â€œIf the consumer wishes to purchase a higher-priced band, we suggest that they read the product descriptions and avoid any that are listed as containing fluoroelastomers,â€ Wicks was quoted as saying. She suggests that the next time you go shopping for straps and bands, look for the word fluoroelastomer and avoid them, if possible.
Editorsâ€™ Recommendations A company you wouldnâ€™t expect just beat Apple as the No. 1 smartwatch brand These are the 5 smartwatches you should look forward to in 2024 Hereâ€™s why scientists really want you to clean your smartwatch Are smartwatches and fitness trackers making us more anxious? Nomadâ€™s new Titanium and Steel Bands are the treat your Apple Watch deserves
